abstract: The Dow dates from a computer-free era when working out the average of 30 stock prices counted as added value. Including Apple in the index was overdue.
snippet: The Dow dates from a computer-free era when working out the average of 30 stock prices counted as added value. Including Apple in the index was overdue.
lead_paragraph: Apple’s entry into the Dow Jones industrial average is a bit like polishing an antique. The average share price of 30 stocks selected by committee will finally include the world’s biggest company in place of AT&T. It’s an overdue move for an outdated yardstick — one that, like landlines and checkbooks, lives on.

headline.main: Apple’s Entry Will Help an Antiquated Dow Catch Up

byline.original: By Robert Cyran and Richard Beales
